p: According to the previous study on SARS-CoV, SARS-specific IgG Ab may ultimately fade away, and the peripheral memory B cell response cannot be detected in recovered SARS patients. In stark contrast, the memory response of specific T cells lasted at least six years, implicating the significance of cellular immunity for preventing the recurrence epidemics [138]. With regard to the technical routes, we can see efforts to espouse ‘quick-fix’ programs for the purpose of developing vaccines against COVID-19 worldwide [139]. There is a desperate need for selecting effective technical routes to develop different kinds of vaccines ( i.e., live-attenuated vaccines, inactivated vaccines, nucleic acid vaccines, subunit, recombinant, polysaccharide and conjugate vaccines) in a quicker and safer manner [140].
